techmeme.title: The Linux Foundation launches an initiative to fund developing Chromium projects in a "neutral space", with support from Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Opera (Kevin Purdy/Ars Technica)
Court docs: Mark Zuckerberg gave the Meta team training Llama AI models approval to use data from LibGen, which offers access to pirated, copyrighted material (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Internal data: Spotify had about 55M US subscribers as of Q3 2024, of which only around 607,000 were on the cheaper "basic" plan that doesn't include audiobooks (Ashley Carman/Bloomberg)
Sources: many of Meta's employees are furious about its moderation changes allowing "allegations of mental illness" when based on "gender or sexual orientation" (Jason Koebler/404 Media)
NYC-based Captions, an AI-powered video editing app, introduces a free tier with basic video editing tools, while keeping AI features in the $10/month Pro tier (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
